comments.body: to confirm, this change is because when BCT finds > 1 possible BCT now it chooses one based on 'an order' (based on the type id internally) rather than the first candidate in the list? This seems innocuous in this case since it's only observable because base, base2 and iface types are empty types, if they have members then iface is chosen today.
Right, BCT without a contextual type is now the same as a union type of the elements, and the consitutent types of a union type is an unordered set.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +298,302 @@
            var b1 = [baseObj, base2Obj, ifaceObj];
>b1 : iface[]
>[baseObj, base2Obj, ifaceObj] : iface[]
>baseObj : base
